title: Image Source Credibility
text: An image source refers to the origin or creator of the image. Evaluating it involves assessing who produced the image and their credibility.

title: Putting the Image in Context
text: Consider how the image relates to the surrounding text or scenario. Context provides additional information that can help determine the image's relevance and appropriateness.

title: Identifying Needed Images
text: This involves determining what specific images are necessary for a given purpose or research. It's about planning what type of visual information is required.

title: Finding Images Online
text: Using search functions and criteria on the internet to locate images that match your needs. While useful, it requires careful evaluation of credibility.
